intro: Psychotria albert-smithii, commonly known as Albert-Smith's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
